message: anyone using Rubinius? in production too?
nice! any issues?
wouldn't eri be more correct? :)
reference: http://rubini.us/
yeah, we have one deployment of a sinatra app at the university with rbx.
not really, no.
in a perfect future, rubinius is the new mri.
What's killer about Rubinius?
it's a very clean implementations
I mean, it's faster -- but it isn't that much from the benchmarks I've seen so far, but I guess that'll get better.
implementation*
It's Ruby
you can also run a bunch of different languages on the compiler
until you reach turtles, of course.
yeah, rubinius has extremely high quality code. real enjoyable to read. also, it's even more flexible than normal ruby. objects, all the way down.

There's a lot of cool stuff happening in both rbx and JRuby. I'm a bit more excited about JRuby based on its insanely wide compatibility (C extensions, Java libs, any other JVM language). That said, evanphx and headius have been talking quite a bit lately about working toward a common extension API, which would be rad.

Matz likes it and has said something about using rbx VM as a basis. I haven't heard much on the topic in quite sometime, so it could go either way. Personally, I'm invested in Rubinius and hope it is the basis of Ruby 2.0 but rbx will evolve regardless of adoption. Rubinius is also being used to power alternative languages as well. Someone has started a Python implementation called Typhon as an example of other languages hosted on rbx. Fancy is using rbx's to host itself.
As soon as hydra branch is released I'm gonna use it all the time both in development and production.
Ya, really impressed with the state of fancy. Typhon does not yet include its own parser, afaik, so you can't really use it without Python.

What would you guys want to see improved/changed in a hypothethical Ruby 2.0? I for one would like blocks to be unified. Do we really need that many syntaxes for creating/calling blocks which also may have different effects based on usage of some return/break etc. keywords. I would like the non-object block forms for methods to be gone. Even javascript can attach multiple callback functions in a consistent way, in Ruby it's not so obvious :o(. (object) blocks as keyword arguments to a method would have been awesome.
i'd rather have a faster, better, harder, stronger ruby than new features or different syntax, personally
^^^^ this
ruby library is a ghetto (cit.)
(waiting for ruby 2.0)
I second @defunkt - speed and stability are my primary concerns with ruby.
That's what we expect in python also, more speed and less syntax changes
Hear hear. I don't think having three (more?) different ways of creating/calling blocks is turning anyone off of Ruby, but speed, stability, and memory footprint definitely do.
yeah, after proc { |&b| } was allowed, I think the -> syntax is just noise…
Rubinius built-in debugging tools are way nice to pass up.
Pretty crazy announcement from Brian today: http://rubini.us/2011/02/17/rubinius-what-s-next/

Runtime type profiling, improvements to the JIT / codegen, impending landing of the Hydra branch, 1.9 support, Windows support, a VM that can be targeted by other programming languages, and a new parallel build system.
When the Hydra branch will be merged?
The Hydra-branch stuff looks just ridiculously exciting. Not sure about The Future but 2011 could be a very good year for Rubinius.
I would like to see a smalltalk-like editor for ruby, where you can change code/objects dynamically
Wasn't that what MagLev was supposed to do?
And if they remove the GIL, then one VM seems plenty. :)
We can't wait on them forever :-p Rubinius is really nice, but a bit big though

~/code/rubinius $ ls -lh vm/vm
-rwxr-xr-x 1 zimbatm users 69M Feb 19 21:37 vm/vm
~/code/rubinius $ ./vm/vm &
[1] 8461
~/code/rubinius $ top -b -n 1 -p 8461 | tail -n3
  PID USER      PR  NI  VIRT  RES  SHR S %CPU %MEM    TIME+  COMMAND           
 8461 zimbatm   20   0  161m  40m 9816 T    0  0.5   0:01.21 vm

Can't be any worse than JRuby: 



PID    COMMAND      %CPU TIME     #TH  #WQ  #POR #MRE RPRVT RSHRD  RSIZE VPRVT VSIZE
13354  java         0.0  00:08.17 17   1    158  213  101M  3372K  119M  474M  3151M
RUBINIUS <3
@zimbatm have you seen the pry gem? it might ease your pain
@locks thx nice gem. It's not really a pain, more of a concept
@zimbatm you can interface with maglev from a pharo image. will even give you the pharo debugger
@rkh  nice, can it also serialize the code back to disk ? (in text file, not binary blob)
